history.content:
Yes, unless you use grandfather option to fulfill data 8 requirement no later than spring 2019.The approved substitution for Data 8 is [one from CS 61A or Engineering 7] + [one from Stat 20, 21, W21, 131A or 135]. First year students admitted to UC Berkeley in or after Fall 2018 are not eligible to substitute for Data 8.

------

(update from data science support piazza 3 days ago)

Due to high demand for enrollment in Data 8, our faculty have recently determined that continuing students who plan to declare the Data Science major may use the grandfathered substitution options for Data 8 in Spring 2019 if necessary. The approved substitution for Data 8 is [one from CS 61A or Engineering 7] + [one from Stat 20, 21, W21, 131A or 135].
 
This option is best suited for students who have already completed CS 61A or one of the approved Statistics options. Intended Data Science majors who have not yet completed any of these courses are strongly encouraged to take Data 8.
 
First year students admitted to UC Berkeley in or after Fall 2018 are not eligible to substitute for Data 8.

Yes, unless you use grandfather option to fulfill data 8 requirement no later than spring 2019.The approved substitution for Data 8 is [one from CS 61A or Engineering 7] + [one from Stat 20, 21, W21, 131A or 135]. First year students admitted to UC Berkeley in or after Fall 2018 are not eligible to substitute for Data 8.
so i took data 100 this semester and i'm considering possibly double majoring/minoring in data science. if i already took data 100, do i have to take data 8 to meet the lower div requirements?
